meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of creosote.
meanings.sent1: The creosotic smell of the wooden fence filled the air.
meanings.sent2: The old shed had a creosotic appearance due to the dark, tar-like coating.
meanings.sent3: The creosotic fence seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a creosotic quality, deep and lingering.
meanings.sent5: The creosotic nature of the wood made it resistant to decay.

meanings.sent1: The creosotic solution was used to preserve the wood.
meanings.sent2: The creosotic smell reminded him of the railroad ties.
meanings.sent3: The creosotic liquid shimmered in the sunlight like a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her hair had a creosotic shine, dark and glossy.
meanings.sent5: The creosotic taste lingered on his tongue long after he finished the drink.

meanings.sent1: The creosotic logs stood strong against the harsh weather.
meanings.sent2: The creosotic wood had a distinct dark color.
meanings.sent3: The creosotic fence seemed to repel even the bravest of termites.
meanings.sent4: His creosotic hands bore the marks of hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The creosotic surface of the deck glistened in the morning dew.
